history.content:
I took 189 and 182 last spring and found both very manageable. Content introduced early in 182 complements content latter in 189 making it somewhat easier.  You should be fine taking both together.

189 and 188 have some overlap but not too much. Probability used early in 189 help with latter 188 content a bit. 182 and 188 both cover RL latter in the semester so it might feel like you're learning an easier and harder version of RL at the same time.

children.subject: I've been told that 188 have been gradually getting harder over the semester. It was relatively easy, a lot easier than 182, when I took it in Fa20 so I'd be comfortable doing all three. But I hear that 188 have been trying to match the difficulty of 170 so it might be harder when you take it this spring. Worst case, your workload would be equivalent to 189 + 182 + 170.
<md>Hmm got it. How would you rate the difficulty of 182 in comparison to 189? </md>
For me 182 was easier. Easier and fewer project  compared to 189 HW, 2 MT and a final project instead of exam last spring.
<md>Thanks for the answer Anon Mouse! Would you be able to comment on the workload for the 3 combined? As in how challenging it would be if I decided to juggle all 3 together next sem?</md>

history.content:
<md>Hey guys, was thinking of taking 182 + 188 + 189 next semester and was curious to hear what people think about the workload? 

Generally I take only 2 techs a semester but since this is going to be my last semester, I wanted to come out of it learning as much as I could. Some past semesters have been 162/127, 161/186, 170/126, etc. all of which I've found pretty manageable tbh. 

In terms of difficulty levels, I expect 189 to be the most time consuming/difficult. 188 I'm assuming will be the easiest since my roommate took it a few semesters ago and I remember him barely having to spend time on the projects for it. Not really sure about the difficulty level for 182. Let me know whether you guys think this will be too much or if it's doable. 

Would also like any opinions on whether it's possible to do 182 concurrently with 189 or not?</md>
history.subject: Workload for 182/188/189?
